# Incomplete-action verbs

## Introduction

So far we have learned completed-action verbs with the different doer-modifications. In this chapter we will learn incomplete-action verbs. These verbs are used when the action of the verb is on-going or has not yet begun.

Completed-action verbs' doer-modifications are suffixes to the verb. In contrast, incomplete-action verbs' doer-modifications affect both the beginning and the end of the basic verb stem. Another difference from completed-action verbs is that incomplete-action verbs have states (u-state, a-state, etc.), similar to nouns.

As an example, the completed action verb for the root [كتب]{.arroot} is [كَتَبَ]{.ar} [kataba]{.trn} "he wrote" for the non-participator masculine singular. The corresponding incomplete-action verb is
